Directions
Cut carrots into small dice, peeling them if you wish. Cook over moderate heat in a deep pan with olive oil. Peel and finely slice onion
,
add to the pan, and cook for a good 15 minutes, till the onion is deep gold and the carrots lightly browned.
Add lentils
,
rinsed if necessary, into the pan, then pour in vegetable stock and bring to a boil. Lower the heat so the liquid simmers and leave to cook until the lentils are soft—anything from 25 to 40 minutes. Season with salt toward the end of cooking.
Put a large pan of water on to boil for the pasta and salt it generously. Cook pappardelle until al dente.
While the pasta cooks, remove half the lentils and their liquid and process to a coarse puree in a blender or food processor. Return them to the pan and stir in crème fraîche and balsamic vinegar. Check seasoning and bring almost to a simmer.
Drain the pasta, divide among warm bowls, then spoon over lentil ragù.
